block.p: Diamonds, furs, and head-to-toe logos too subtle? Well, here comes the most salient style statement yet for these fashion boom times: solid gold.

Harper's Bazaar and Vogue ran fashion spreads with models decked in gold this month and the ''Sex and the City'' stylist, Patricia Field, put Sarah Jessica Parker in knee-high gold boots by Casadei for the season's opening show.
Diamonds, furs, and head-to-toe logos too subtle? Well, here comes the most salient style statement yet for these fashion boom times: solid gold.

Harper's Bazaar and Vogue ran fashion spreads with models decked in gold this month and the ''Sex and the City'' stylist, Patricia Field, put Sarah Jessica Parker in knee-high gold boots by Casadei for the season's opening show.
''Gold is synonymous with money,'' Ms. Field said. ''It's like saying we're rich and we want to show it.''

Shown here is a pair of metallic leather capri pants by Searle, $445; Jennifer Jones's mesh gold metal halter ($375 at Language); Malini & Sulaika gold metal mesh cocktail bag, $110 at Searle; Jimmy Choo Cactus sandals, $365; Fendi aviators, $200.
The Chloe store on Madison Avenue sold out of the chunky multichain bracelets and slinky belts in February, but they're still available at Language ($120 to $130).

To take the look home, Zao sells Tampopo gold ceramic bowls and plates ($12 to $50), and little gold metal journals ($55) to write in, perhaps while soaking in a bath filled with Celebrity Skin by Stuf from Lafco New York, a new gold body shimmer that you put in the tub to give your skin a touch of golden dust ($15 at Mxyplyzyk and on the Web at beautyjungle.com).
